children.comment: Everything in Dart is an [Object].
children.name: Object

children.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all [Object]s is to return true if and
only if [:this:] and [other] are the same object.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override
the [hashCode] method as well to maintain consistency.
Returns a string representation of this object.
children.name: toString

children.comment:
[noSuchMethod] is invoked when users invoke a non-existant method
on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the
invocation are passed to [noSuchMethod] in an [Invocation].
If [noSuchMethod] returns a value, that value becomes the result of
the original invocation.

The default behavior of [noSuchMethod] is to throw a
[noSuchMethodError].
children.name: noSuchMethod

children.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the
same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality
operator [:==:]. Other than that there are no guarantees about
the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and
there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides [hashCode] it should override the
equality operator as well to maintain consistency.
children.name: hashCode

children.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.
children.name: runtimeType

children.comment:
Creates a new [Object] instance.

[Object] instances have no meaningful state, and are only useful
through their identity. An [Object] instance is equal to itself
only.
children.name: Object

children.comment:
An abstract class for a disposable object.
You must implement [finalize]
children.name: Disposable

children.comment:
Pin the disposable object. See [dispose] for inverse.
Throws an exception if this object is already disposed.
children.name: pin

children.comment:
Disposes of the object. If nothing else has this object pinned,
the finalizer will be called. See [pin] for inverse. Throws
an exception if the object is already disposed.
children.name: dispose

children.comment: Clean up any object state here.
children.name: finalize

children.comment: This object has been disposed.
children.name: isDisposed

children.comment: Count of pins
children.name: pinCount

children.comment: Vertex buffer slot to fetch from.
children.name: vboSlot

children.comment: Shader attribute index.
children.name: attributeIndex

children.comment: Offset into buffer to fetch at.
children.name: attributeOffset

children.comment: Stride between vertices.
children.name: attributeStride

children.comment: Type of data.
children.name: dataType

children.comment: Number of dataType to be fetched for this attribute.
children.name: dataCount

children.comment:
Data is converted into a normalized floating point value.
0.0 ... 1.0 for unsigned, -1.0 ... 1.0 for signed data.
children.name: normalizeData

children.comment: Key frame animation data for an entire skeleton.
children.name: SkeletonAnimation

children.comment: Animates [skeleton] to time [t] and updates [posedSkeleton].
children.name: poseSkeleton

children.comment: Key frame animation data for a single bone in a skeleton.
children.name: BoneAnimation

children.comment: Makes bone have no position animation.
children.name: setNoPositionAnimation

children.comment:
Makes room for [length] position animation frames.
All position animation frames will be zero.
children.name: setPositionAnimationLength

children.comment: Builds bone animation data from key frames in [positions].
children.name: updatePositions

children.comment: Makes bone have no rotation animation.
children.name: setNoRotationAnimation

children.comment:
Makes room for [length] rotation animation frames.
All rotation animation frames will be zero.
children.name: setRotationAnimationLength

children.comment: Builds bone animation data from key frames in [rotations].
children.name: updateRotations

children.comment: Makes bone have no scale animation.
children.name: setNoScaleAnimation

children.comment:
Makes room for [length] scale animation frames.
All scale animation frames will be zero.
children.name: setScaleAnimationLength

children.comment: Builds bone animation data from key frames in [scales].
children.name: updateScales

children.comment:
Set [boneMatrix] to correspond to bone animation at time [t].
Does not interpolate between key frames.
children.name: setBoneMatrixAtTime

children.comment:
Set [boneMatrix] to correspond to bone animation at time [t].
Does not interpolate between key frames.
children.name: setBoneMatrixAtTimeSIMD

children.comment:
Set bone matrix [transform] to correspond to bone animation at time [t].
Does interpolate between key frames.
children.name: setBoneMatrixAtTimeInterpolate

children.comment:
Construct bone animation with [boneName]. Animation key frames
will be loaded from [positions], [rotations], and [scales].
children.name: BoneAnimation

children.comment:
Poses [skeleton] using [animation] at time [t]. Posed skeleton
is stored in [posedSkeleton].
children.name: pose

children.comment: Skeleton ready to be used for skinning.
children.name: PosedSkeleton

children.comment: Skeleton.

children.comment: Bone.

children.comment:
The window dimensions of a render-target surface onto which a 3D
volume projects.
Set using [GraphicsContext.setViewport]

children.comment:
The width of the viewport on the render-target surface, in pixels.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not a positive number.

children.comment:
The height of the viewport on the render-target surface, in pixels.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not a positive number.
children.name: height=

children.comment:
The minimum depth of the viewport.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not in the range [0, 1].
children.name: minDepth=

children.comment:
The maximum depth of the viewport.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not in the range [0, 1].
children.name: maxDepth=

The y-coordinate of the upper left corner of the viewport on the

children.comment: Buffer usage pattern.
children.name: UsagePattern

children.comment: Modified once. Few uses.
children.name: StreamDraw

children.comment: Modified once. Many uses.
children.name: StaticDraw

children.comment: Modified repeatedly. Many uses.
children.name: DynamicDraw

children.comment:
Texture2D defines the storage for a 2D texture including Mipmaps
Set using [GraphicsContext.setTextures]
NOTE: Unlike OpenGL, Spectre textures do not describe how they are sampled
children.name: Texture2D

children.comment:
Replace texture contents with data stored in [array].
If [array] is null, space will be allocated on the GPU
children.name: uploadPixelArray

children.comment:
Replace texture contents with image data from [element].
Supported for [ImageElement], [VideoElement], and [CanvasElement].

The image data will be converted to [pixelFormat] and [pixelType] before
being uploaded to the GPU.
children.name: uploadElement

children.comment:
Replace texture contents with data fetched from [url].
If an error occurs while fetching the image, loadError will be true.
children.name: uploadFromURL

children.comment:
Generate mipmaps for the [Texture2D].

This must be done before the texture is used for rendering.

A call to this method will only generate mipmap data if the
texture is a power of two. If not then this call is ignored.
children.name: generateMipmap

children.comment: Did an error occur when loading from a URL?
children.name: loadError

children.comment: Defines filtering types for minification during texture sampling.
children.name: TextureMinFilter

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [TextureMinFilter].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [TextureMinFilter] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment: Use linear filtering for minification.
children.name: Linear

children.comment: Use point filtering for minification.
children.name: Point

children.comment: Defines filtering types for magnification during texture sampling.
children.name: TextureMagFilter

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [TextureMagFilter].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [TextureMagFilter] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment: Use linear filtering for magnification.
children.name: Linear

children.comment: Use point filtering for magnification.
children.name: Point

children.comment: Use point filtering to expand, and point filtering between mipmap levels.
children.name: PointMipPoint

children.comment: Use point filtering to expand, and linear filtering between mipmap levels.
children.name: PointMipLinear

children.comment: Use linear filtering to expand, and point filtering between mipmap levels.
children.name: LinearMipPoint

children.comment: Use linear filtering to expand, and linear filtering between mipmap levels.
children.name: LinearMipLinear

children.comment:
Generate Mipmap data for texture. This must be done before the texture
can be used for rendering.
children.name: generateMipmap

children.comment:
Defines modes for addressing texels using texture coordinates outside of
the typical range of 0.0 to 1.0.
children.name: TextureAddressMode

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [TextureAddressMode].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [TextureAddressMode] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment:
Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the texture
color at 0.0 or 1.0, respectively.
children.name: Clamp

children.comment:
Similar to Wrap, except that the texture is flipped at every integer
junction.

For values between 0 and 1, for example, the texture is addressed
normally; between 1 and 2, the texture is
flipped (mirrored); between 2 and 3, the texture is normal again, and so
on.
children.name: Mirror

children.comment:
Tile the texture at every integer junction.

For example, for u values between 0 and 3, the texture is repeated three
times;
no mirroring is performed.
children.name: Wrap

children.comment:
Set the internal format used for this texture.

NOTE: Will not take affect until next upload.
children.name: textureFormat=

children.comment: Bind this texture and return the previously bound texture.
children.name: _pushBind

children.comment: Rebind [oldBind]
children.name: _popBind

children.comment: Binds the texture to [unit].
children.name: _bind

children.comment:
Determines whether a [value] is a power of two.

Assumes that the given value will always be positive.
children.name: _isPowerOfTwo

children.comment: Retrieve the internal format used for this texture
children.name: textureFormat

children.comment: Defines various types of surface formats.
children.name: SurfaceFormat

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [SurfaceFormat].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [SurfaceFormat] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a compressed format.
children.name: _isCompressedFormat

children.comment:
Retrieves the internal format used by the surface.

WebGL does not determine the internal format based on the surface type
so this must be queried directly.
children.name: _getInternalFormat

children.comment:
32-bit RGBA pixel format with alpha, using 8 bits per channel.

Underlying format is an unsigned byte.
children.name: Rgba

children.comment:
24-bit RGB pixel format, using 8 bits per channel.

Underlying format is an unsigned byte.
children.name: Rgb

children.comment:
DXT1 compression format.

Only available if the compressed texture s3tc extension is supported.
Assumes the texture has no alpha component. DXT1 can support
alpha but only 1-bit.
children.name: Dxt1

children.comment:
DXT3 compression format.

Only available if the compressed texture s3tc extension is supported.
children.name: Dxt3

children.comment:
DXT5 compression format.

Only available if the compressed texture s3tc extension is supported.
children.name: Dxt5

children.comment:
A shader program specifies the behaviour of the programmable GPU pipeline.
You can apply a shader program to the GPU pipeline with
[GraphicsContext.setShaderProgram].
children.name: ShaderProgram

children.comment: Detach [shader] from ShaderProgram.
children.name: _detach

children.comment: Attach [shader] from ShaderProgram. See also: [link]
children.name: _attach

children.comment: Link attached shaders together forming a shader program.
children.name: link

children.comment: Output each uniform variable input to the log.
children.name: logUniforms

children.comment: Output each sampler input to the log.
children.name: logSamplers

children.comment: Output each attribute input to the log.
children.name: logAttributes

children.comment:
Iterate over all active uniform inputs and call [callback] for each one.

See [UniformCallback].
children.name: forEachUniform

children.comment:
Iteraete over all active sampler inputs and call [callback] for each one.

See [SamplerCallback].
children.name: forEachSampler

children.comment:
Iterate over all active attribute inputs and call [callback] for each one.

See [AttributeCallback].
children.name: forEachAttribute

children.comment: Update the stored value for [uniform] with [argument].
children.name: updateUniform

children.comment: Set Uniform variable [name] in this [ShaderProgram].
children.name: setConstant

children.comment: Is the shader program linked?
children.name: linked

children.comment: Output from most recent linking. Can be [null]
children.name: linkLog

children.comment: A shader program attribute input
children.name: ShaderProgramAttribute

children.comment: A shader program sampler input
children.name: ShaderProgramSampler

children.comment: A shader program uniform input
children.name: ShaderProgramUniform

children.comment: Contains sampler state, which determines how to sample texture data.
children.name: SamplerState

children.comment:
The minification filter to use.

Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[TextureMinFilter].
children.name: minFilter=

children.comment:
The magnification filter to use.

If the [SpectreTexture] does not contain mipmaps, such as non-power of
two textures, then the only valid values are Texture.Linear and
Texture.Point.

Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[TextureMinFilter].
children.name: magFilter=

children.comment:
The maximum anisotropy.

Anisotropic filtering is only available through an extension to WebGL.
The maximum acceptable value is dependent on the graphics hardware, and
can be queried within [GraphicsDeviceCapabilities]. When setting the value
the anisotropy level will be capped to the range 1 <
[GraphicsDeviceCapabilities.maxAnisotropyLevel]

Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not a positive number.
children.name: maxAnisotropy=

children.comment: Serializes the [SamplerState] to a JSON.
children.name: toJson

children.comment: Deserializes the [SamplerState] from a JSON.
children.name: fromJson

children.name: addressU

children.comment: The texture-address mode for the v-coordinate.
children.name: addressV

children.name: _addressUName

children.comment: Serialization name for [addressV].
children.name: _addressVName

children.comment: Serialization name for [minFilter].
children.name: _minFilterName

children.comment: Serialization name for [magFilter].
children.name: _magFilterName

children.comment: Serialization name for [maxAnisotropy].
children.name: _maxAnisotropyName

children.comment: The texture-address mode for the u-coordinate.
children.name: _addressU

children.comment: The texture-address mode for the v-coordinate.
children.name: _addressV

children.comment: The minification filter to use.
children.name: _minFilter

children.comment: The magnification filter to use.
children.name: _magFilter

children.comment:
The maximum anisotropy.

The default value is 1.0.
children.name: _maxAnisotropy

children.comment: Creates an instance of [SamplerState] with default values.
children.name: SamplerState
SamplerState.anisotropicClamp
SamplerState.anisotropicWrap
SamplerState.linearClamp
SamplerState.linearWrap
SamplerState.pointClamp
SamplerState.pointWrap

children.comment:
A [RenderTarget] specifies the buffers where color, depth, and stencil
are written to during a draw call.

NOTE: To output into the system provided render target see
[RenderTarget.systemRenderTarget]
children.name: RenderTarget

children.comment: Bind this texture and return the previously bound framebuffer.
children.name: _pushBind

children.comment: Rebind [oldBind]
children.name: _popBind

children.comment:
Set color target to be [colorBuffer].

A color buffer must be a [Texture2D] or [RenderBuffer].

A null color buffer indicates the system provided color buffer.
children.name: colorTarget=

children.comment:
Set depth buffer output to be [depth].

null indicates the system provided depth buffer.

The depth buffer can be a [Texture2D] or [RenderBuffer].

Set depth target to be [depthBuffer].

A depth buffer must be a [Texture2D] or [RenderBuffer].

A null depth buffer indicates the system provided depth buffer.
children.name: depthTarget=

children.comment: System provided rendering target
children.name: systemRenderTarget

children.comment: Is the render target valid and renderable?
children.name: isRenderable

children.comment:
A [RenderBuffer] represents the storage for either a color, depth,
or stencil buffer render target attachment.
children.name: RenderBuffer

children.comment:
Allocate storage for render buffer with [format] and
[width]x[height] pixels.
children.name: allocateStorage

children.comment:
RasterizerState controls how the GPU rasterizer functions including
primitive culling and width of rasterized lines
Set using [GraphicsContext.setRasterizerState]
children.name: RasterizerState

children.comment:
Spcifies what triangles are culled based on its direction.
The default value is [CullMode.Back].
Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[CullMode].
children.name: cullMode=

children.comment:
Specifies the winding of a front facing polygon.
The default value is [FrontFace.CounterClockwise].
Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[FrontFace].
children.name: frontFace=

children.comment: Serializes the [RasterizerState] to a JSON.
children.name: toJson

children.comment: Deserializes the [RasterizerState] from a JSON.
children.name: fromJson

children.comment:
The depth bias for polygons.
This is the amount of bias to apply to the depth of a primitive to
alleviate depth testing
problems for primitives of similar depth.
The default value is 0.
children.name: depthBias

children.comment:
A bias value that takes into account the slope of a polygon.
This bias value is applied to coplanar primitives to reduce aliasing and
other rendering
artifacts caused by z-fighting.
The default is 0.
children.name: slopeScaleDepthBias

children.comment:
Whether scissor testing is enabled.
ScissorTestEnable  Enables or disables scissor testing.
The default is false.
children.name: scissorTestEnabled

children.comment: Serialization name for [cullMode].
children.name: _cullModeName

children.comment: Serialization name for [frontFace].
children.name: _frontFaceName

children.comment: Serialization name for [depthBias].
children.name: _depthBiasName

children.comment: Serialization name for [slopeScaleDepthBias].
children.name: _slopeScaleDepthBiasName

children.comment: Serialization name for [scissorTestEnabled].
children.name: _scissorTestEnabledName

children.comment:
Spcifies what triangles are culled based on its direction.
The default value is [CullMode.Back].
children.name: _cullMode

children.comment:
Specifies the winding of a front facing polygon.
The default value is [FrontFace.CounterClockwise].
children.name: _frontFace

children.comment:
The depth bias for polygons.
This is the amount of bias to apply to the depth of a primitive to alleviate depth testing
problems for primitives of similar depth.
The default value is 0.
children.name: _depthBias

children.comment:
A bias value that takes into account the slope of a polygon.
This bias value is applied to coplanar primitives to reduce aliasing and other rendering
artifacts caused by z-fighting.
The default is 0.
children.name: _slopeScaleDepthBias

children.comment:
Whether scissor testing is enabled.
ScissorTestEnable  Enables or disables scissor testing.
The default is false.
children.name: _scissorTestEnabled

children.comment: Creates a new instance of the [RasterizerState] class.
children.name: RasterizerState
RasterizerState.cullClockwise
RasterizerState.cullCounterClockwise
RasterizerState.cullNone

children.comment: Set the shader program. Input layout will be verified to be [ready].

In order for a InputLayout to be ready the mesh must have
all the attributes the shader program requires.

children.comment:
Allows the querying of the capabilities of the [GraphicsDevice].

Can be used to get maximum values for the underlying WebGL implementation as
well as access what WebGL extensions are available.
children.name: GraphicsDeviceCapabilities

children.name: toString

children.comment: Queries context info using the [WebGL.RenderingContext].

children.name: _queryDeviceInfo

Queries the [WebGL.RenderingContext] to see if the given extension is
available.
children.name: _hasExtension

Queries the [WebGL.RenderingContext] to retrieve the given extension.

Returns [null] if the extension is not supported.
children.name: _getExtension

children.comment: The graphics card vendor
children.name: vendor

children.comment: The renderer
children.name: renderer

children.comment: Whether a depth buffer is available.
children.name: depthBuffer

children.comment: Whether a stencil buffer is available.

children.comment: The number of texture units available.

children.comment: The number of texture units available in the vertex shader
children.name: vertexShaderTextureUnits

children.comment: The largest texture size available.
children.name: maxTextureSize

children.comment: The largest cube map texture size available.
children.name: maxCubeMapTextureSize

children.comment: The largest anisotropy level available.
children.name: maxAnisotropyLevel

children.comment: Maximum number of vertex attributes available.
children.name: maxVertexAttribs

children.comment: Maximum number of varying vectors available in the shader program.
children.name: maxVaryingVectors

children.comment: Maximum number of uniforms available in the vertex shader.
children.name: maxVertexShaderUniforms

children.comment: Maximum number of uniforms available in the fragment shader.

children.comment: Whether floating point textures are available.

children.comment:
Whether standard derivatives (dFdx, dFdy, fwidth) are available in the
fragment shader.

children.comment: Whether vertex array objects are available.
children.name: hasVertexArrayObjects

children.comment: Whether the renderer and vendor can be queried for debug purposes.
children.name: hasDebugRendererInfo

children.comment: Whether the translated shader source can be viewed.
children.name: hasDebugShaders

children.comment: Whether unsigned int can be used as an index.
children.name: hasUnsignedIntIndices

children.comment: Whether anisotropic filtering is available.
children.name: hasAnisotropicFiltering

children.comment: Whether context losing/restoring can be simulated.
children.name: canLoseContext

children.comment: Whether S3TC compressed textures can be used.

children.comment: Whether depth textures can be used.

children.comment: Whether multiple render targets can be used.

children.name: hasInstancedArrays

children.name: _vertexShaderTextureUnits

children.comment: The largest texture size available.

children.comment: The largest anisotropy level available.
children.name: _maxAnisotropyLevel

children.comment: Spectre GPU Device
children.name: GraphicsDevice

children.comment:
Initializes an instance of the [GraphicsDevice] class.

A [WebGL.RenderingContext] is created from the given [surface].
Additionally an
optional instance of [GraphicsDeviceConfig] can be passed in to control
the creation of the underlying frame buffer.
children.name: GraphicsDevice

children.comment: The [GraphicsContext] configures the GPU pipeline and executes draw commands.
children.name: GraphicsContext

children.comment:
Initialize the WebGL pipeline state.
Creates all the default state values and applies them to the pipeline.
children.name: _initializeState

children.comment: Resets the cached GPU pipeline state
children.name: reset

children.comment: Configure the primitive topology
children.name: setPrimitiveTopology

children.comment: Set the IndexBuffer to [indexBufferHandle]
children.name: setIndexBuffer

children.comment: Set multiple VertexBuffers in [vertexBufferHandles] starting at [startSlot]
children.name: setVertexBuffers

children.comment: Set InputLayout to [inputLayoutHandle]
children.name: setInputLayout

children.comment: Set ShaderProgram to [shaderProgramHandle]
children.name: setShaderProgram

children.comment: Sets a [Viewport] identifying the portion of the render target to receive draw calls.
children.name: setViewport

children.comment:
Sets the current [BlendState] to use on the pipeline.

If [blendState] is null all values of the pipeline associated with blending
will be reset to their defaults.
children.name: setBlendState

children.comment:
Sets the current [DepthState] to use on the pipeline.

If [depthState] is null all values of the pipeline associated with depth
will be reset to their defaults.
children.name: setDepthState

children.comment:
Sets the current [RasterizerState] to use on the pipeline.

If [rasterizerState] is null all values of the pipeline associated with rasterization
will be reset to their defaults.
children.name: setRasterizerState

children.comment: Set RenderTarget to [renderTargetHandle]
children.name: setRenderTarget

children.comment: Sets a list of [textureHandles] starting at [texUnitOffset]
children.name: setTextures

children.comment: Sets a list of [samplerHandles] starting at [texUnitOffset]
children.name: setSamplers

children.comment: Draw an indexed mesh with [numIndices] starting at [indexOffset]
children.name: drawIndexed

children.comment: Draw a mesh with [numVertices] starting at [vertexOffset]
children.name: draw

children.comment:
The default [BlendState] to use.
Constructed with the values in [BlendState.opaque].
children.name: _blendStateDefault

children.comment:
The default [DepthState] to use.
Constructed with the values in [DepthState.depthWrite].
children.name: _depthStateDefault

children.comment:
The default [RasterizerState] to use.
Constructed with the values in [RasterizerState.cullClockwise].
children.name: _rasterizerStateDefault

children.comment: The current [Viewport] of the pipeline.
children.name: _viewport

children.comment: The current [BlendState] of the pipeline.
children.name: _blendState

children.comment: The current [DepthState] of the pipeline.
children.name: _depthState

children.comment: The current [RasterizerState] of the pipeline.
children.name: _rasterizerState

Defines the winding used to determine whether a triangle is front or
back facing.
children.name: FrontFace

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [FrontFace].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [FrontFace] to a [String].

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment: Triangles are considered front-facing if its vertices are clockwise.
children.name: Clockwise

children.comment: Triangles are considered front-facing if its vertices are counter-clockwise.
children.name: CounterClockwise

children.name: compiled

children.comment: Compile log.
children.name: compileLog

children.comment: Enable or disable automatic shader recompilation when source changes.
children.name: autoCompile

children.comment:
Contains depth state for the device.
Set using [GraphicsContext.setDepthState]
children.name: DepthState

children.comment: Serializes the [BlendState] to a JSON.
children.name: toJson

children.comment: Deserializes the [BlendState] from a JSON.
children.name: fromJson

children.comment:
Whether depth buffering is enabled or disabled.
The default is true.
children.name: depthBufferEnabled

children.comment:
Whether writing to the depth buffer is enabled or disabled.
The default is true.
children.name: depthBufferWriteEnabled

children.comment:
The comparison function for the depth-buffer test.
The default is CompareFunction.LessEqual
children.name: depthBufferFunction

children.comment: Serialization name for [depthBufferEnabled].
children.name: _depthBufferEnabledName

children.comment: Serialization name for [depthBufferWriteEnabled].
children.name: _depthBufferWriteEnabledName

children.comment: Serialization name for [depthBufferFunction].
children.name: _depthBufferFunctionName

children.comment:
Whether depth buffering is enabled or disabled.
The default is true.
children.name: _depthBufferEnabled

children.comment:
Whether writing to the depth buffer is enabled or disabled.
The default is true.
children.name: _depthBufferWriteEnabled

children.comment:
The comparison function for the depth-buffer test.
The default is CompareFunction.LessEqual
children.name: _depthBufferFunction

children.comment: Creates an instance of [DepthState] with default values.
children.name: DepthState

children.comment: Creates an instance of [DepthState] with a writeable depth buffer.
children.name: DepthState.depthWrite

children.comment: Creates an instance of [DepthState] with a read-only depth buffer.
children.name: DepthState.depthRead

children.comment: Creates an instance of [DepthState] which doesn't use a depth buffer.
children.name: DepthState.none

children.comment:
The debug draw manager manages a collection of debug primitives that are
drawn each frame. Each debug primitive has a lifetime and the manager
continues to draw each primitive until its lifetime has expired.

The following primitives are supported:

- Lines
- Crosses
- Spheres
- Circles
- Arcs
- Transformations (coordinate axes)
- Triangles
- AABB (Axis Aligned Bounding Boxes)


The following properties can be controlled for each primitive:

- Depth testing on or off.
- Size.
- Color.
- Lifetime.
children.name: DebugDrawManager

children.comment:
Add a line primitive extending from [start] to [finish].
Filled with [color].

Optional parameters: [duration] and [depthEnabled].
children.name: addLine

children.comment:
Add a cross primitive at [point]. Filled with [color].

Optional paremeters: [size], [duration], and [depthEnabled].
children.name: addCross

children.comment:
Add a sphere primitive at [center] with [radius]. Filled with [color].

Optional paremeters: [duration] and [depthEnabled].
children.name: addSphere

children.comment:
Add an arc primitive at [center] in the plane whose normal is
[planeNormal] with a [radius]. The arc begins at [startAngle] and extends
to [stopAngle]. Filled with [color].

Optional parameters: [duration], [depthEnabled], and [numSegments].
children.name: addArc

children.comment:
Add an circle primitive at [center] in the plane whose normal is
[planeNormal] with a [radius]. Filled with [color].

Optional parameters: [duration], [depthEnabled], and [numSegments].
children.name: addCircle

children.comment:
Add a coordinate system primitive. Derived from [xform]. Scaled by [size].

X,Y, and Z axes are colored Red,Green, and Blue

Optional paremeters: [duration], and [depthEnabled]
children.name: addAxes

children.comment:
Add a triangle primitives from vertices [vertex0], [vertex1],
and [vertex2]. Filled with [color].

Optional parameters: [duration] and [depthEnabled]
children.name: addTriangle

children.comment:
Add an Axis Aligned Bounding Box with corners at [boxMin] and [boxMax].
Filled with [color].

Option parameters: [duration] and [depthEnabled]
children.name: addAABB

children.comment: Prepare to render debug primitives
children.name: prepareForRender

children.comment: Render debug primitives for [Camera] [cam]
children.name: render

children.comment: Update time [seconds], removing any dead debug primitives
children.name: update

children.comment:
Construct and initialize a DebugDrawManager. Can specify maximum
number of vertices with [maxVertices].
children.name: DebugDrawManager

children.comment: Data Type.
children.name: DataType

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [DataType].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [DataType] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment: Indicates whether triangles facing a particular direction are drawn.
children.name: CullMode

children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [CullMode] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment: Always draw.
children.name: None

children.comment: Do not draw if triangle is front-facing.
children.name: Front

children.comment: Do not draw if triangle is back-facing.
children.name: Back

children.comment:
Defines comparison functions that can be chosen for stencil,
or depth-buffer tests.
children.name: CompareFunction

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [CompareFunction].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [CompareFunction] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment: Always pass the test.
children.name: Always

children.comment:
Accept the new pixel if its value is equal to the value of the current
pixel.
children.name: Equal

children.comment:
Accept the new pixel if its value is greater than the value of the
current pixel.
children.name: Greater

children.comment:
Accept the new pixel if its value is greater than or equal to the value
of the current pixel.
children.name: GreaterEqual

children.comment:
Accept the new pixel if its value is less than the value of the current
pixel.
children.name: Less

children.comment:
Accept the new pixel if its value is less than or equal to the value of
the current pixel.
children.name: LessEqual

children.comment: Always fail the test.
children.name: Fail

children.comment:
Accept the new pixel if its value does not equal the value of the
current pixel.
children.name: NotEqual

children.comment:
A [SpectreBuffer] represents a buffer of memory on the GPU.
A [SpectreBuffer] can only be constructed by constructing an [IndexBuffer]
or a [VertexBuffer].
children.name: SpectreBuffer

children.comment: Resize buffer to fit [data]. Upload [data] with [usage] hint.
children.name: uploadData

children.comment:
Starting at [offset], upload [data] into buffer.
The length of [data] + offset must not exceed the size of the buffer
children.name: uploadSubData

children.comment: Resize buffer to be [size] bytes with [usage] hint.
children.name: allocate

children.comment: Query the size of the buffer
children.name: size

children.comment: Query the usage hint of the buffer
children.name: usage

children.comment:
BlendState controls how output from your fragment shader is blended onto
the framebuffer. Set using [GraphicsContext.setBlendState].
children.name: BlendState

children.comment:
The red component of the blend factor for alpha blending.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not in the range [0, 1].
children.name: blendFactorRed=

children.comment:
The green component of the blend factor for alpha blending.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not in the range [0, 1].
children.name: blendFactorGreen=

children.comment:
The blue component of the blend factor for alpha blending.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not in the range [0, 1].
children.name: blendFactorBlue=

children.comment:
The alpha component of the blend factor for alpha blending.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [value] is not in the range [0, 1].
children.name: blendFactorAlpha=

children.comment:
The arithmetic operation when blending alpha values.
The default is [BlendOperation.Add]. Throws [ArgumentError] if the
[value] is not an enumeration within [BlendOperation].
children.name: alphaBlendOperation=

children.comment:
The blend factor for the destination alpha; the percentage of the
destination alpha included in the result. The default is [Blend.One].
Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[Blend].
children.name: alphaDestinationBlend=

children.comment:
The alpha blend factor.
The default is [Blend.One].
Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[Blend].
children.name: alphaSourceBlend=

children.comment:
The arithmetic operation when blending color values.
The default is [BlendOperation.Add].
Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[Blend].
children.name: colorBlendOperation=

children.comment:
The blend factor for the destination color.
The default is [Blend.One].
Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[Blend].
children.name: colorDestinationBlend=

children.comment:
The blend factor for the source color.
The default is Blend.One.
Throws [ArgumentError] if the [value] is not an enumeration within
[Blend].
children.name: colorSourceBlend=

children.comment: Serializes the [BlendState] to a JSON.
children.name: toJson

children.comment: Deserializes the [BlendState] from a JSON.
children.name: fromJson

children.comment: Whether blending operations are enabled. Enabled by default.
children.name: _enabled

children.comment: The red component of the blend factor for alpha blending.
children.name: _blendFactorRed

children.comment: The green component of the blend factor for alpha blending.
children.name: _blendFactorGreen

children.comment: The blue component of the blend factor for alpha blending.
children.name: _blendFactorBlue

children.comment: The alpha component of the blend factor for alpha blending.
children.name: _blendFactorAlpha

children.comment:
The arithmetic operation when blending alpha values.
The default is [BlendOperation.Add].
children.name: _alphaBlendOperation

children.comment:
The blend factor for the destination alpha; the percentage of the
destination alpha included in the result.
The default is [Blend.One].
children.name: _alphaDestinationBlend

children.comment:
The alpha blend factor.
The default is [Blend.One].
children.name: _alphaSourceBlend

The arithmetic operation when blending color values.
The default is [BlendOperation.Add].

The blend factor for the destination color.
The default is [Blend.One].
children.name: _colorDestinationBlend

children.comment:
The blend factor for the source color.
The default is Blend.One.

children.comment: Creates an instance of the BlendState class with default values.
children.name: BlendState

children.comment:
Initializes an instance of the BlendState class with settings for
additive blend. This adds the destination data to the source data without
using alpha.
children.name: BlendState.additive

children.comment:
Initializes an intance of the BlendState class with settings for alpha
blend. This blends the source and destination data using alpha.
children.name: BlendState.alphaBlend

children.comment:
Initializes an instance of the BlendState class with settings for blending
with non-premultipled alpha. This blends source and destination data by
using alpha while assuming the color data contains no alpha information.
children.name: BlendState.nonPremultiplied

children.comment:
Initializes an instance of the BlendState class with settings for opaque
blend. This overwrites the source with the destination data.
children.name: BlendState.opaque

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [BlendOperation].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [BlendOperation] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment:
The result is the destination added to the source.

    Result = (Source Color * Source Blend) +
             (Destination Color * Destination Blend)
children.name: Add

children.comment:
The result is the source subtracted from the destination.

    Result = (Destination Color * Destination Blend) -
             (Source Color * Source Blend)
children.name: ReverseSubtract

children.comment:
The result is the destination subtracted from the source.

    Result = (Source Color * Source Blend) -
             (Destination Color * Destination Blend)
children.name: Subtract

children.comment: Defines color blending factors.
children.name: Blend

children.comment: Convert a [String] to a [Blend].
children.name: parse

children.comment: Convert a [Blend] to a [String].
children.name: stringify

children.comment: Checks whether the value is a valid enumeration.
children.name: isValid

children.comment: Each component of the color is multiplied by (0, 0, 0, 0).
children.name: Zero

children.comment: Each component of the color is multiplied by (1, 1, 1, 1).
children.name: One

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by the source color.

This can be represented as (Rs, Gs, Bs, As), where R, G, B, and A
respectively stand for the red, green, blue, and alpha source values.
children.name: SourceColor

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the source
color.
This can be represented as (1  Rs, 1  Gs, 1  Bs, 1  As) where
R, G, B, and A respectively stand for the red, green, blue, and alpha
destination values.
children.name: InverseSourceColor

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by the alpha value of the
source. This can be represented as (As, As, As, As), where As is the
alpha source value.
children.name: SourceAlpha

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the alpha
value of the source.
This can be represented as (1  As, 1  As, 1  As, 1  As), where As is
the alpha destination value.
children.name: InverseSourceAlpha

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by the alpha value of the
destination.

This can be represented as (Ad, Ad, Ad, Ad), where Ad is the destination
alpha value.
children.name: DestinationAlpha

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the alpha
value of the destination.

This can be represented as (1  Ad, 1  Ad, 1  Ad, 1  Ad), where Ad is
the alpha destination value.
children.name: InverseDestinationAlpha

children.comment:
Each component color is multiplied by the destination color.

This can be represented as (Rd, Gd, Bd, Ad), where R, G, B, and A
respectively stand for
red, green, blue, and alpha destination values.
children.name: DestinationColor

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the
destination color.

This can be represented as (1  Rd, 1  Gd, 1  Bd, 1  Ad), where
Rd, Gd, Bd, and Ad respectively stand for the red, green, blue, and alpha
destination values.
children.name: InverseDestinationColor

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by either the alpha of the
source color, or the inverse of the alpha of the source color, whichever
is greater.

This can be represented as (f, f, f, 1), where f = min(A, 1  Ad).
children.name: SourceAlphaSaturation

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by a constant set in
BlendFactor.
children.name: BlendFactor

children.comment:
Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of a constant
set in BlendFactor.
children.name: InverseBlendFactor

children.comment:
A resource created by a device
All resources have a [name]
children.name: DeviceChild
